div.head: CHAP. VIII.
1 The loue of the Church to Christ. 6 The vehemencie of loue. 8 The calling of the Gentiles. 14 The Church prayeth for Christes comming.
div.ab: O that thou wert as my brother that sucked the brests of my mother, when I should find thee without, I would kisse thee, yet I should not be despised. Hebr. they should not despise me.
I would leade thee, and bring thee into my mothers house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drinke of spiced wine, of the iuice of my pomegranate. Prou.9.2.
His left hand should be vnder my head, and his right hand should embrace me. Chap.2.6
I charge you, O daughters of Ierusalem, that ye stirre not vp, nor awake my loue vntill he please. Chap.3.5. and 2.7. , Heb. why should yee stirre vp, or why,&c?

(Who is this that commeth vp from the wildernesse, leaning vpon her beloued?) I raised thee vp vnder the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth, there she brought thee forth, that bare thee. Chap.3.6

¶ Set mee as a seale vpon thine heart, as a seale vpon thine arme: for loue is strong as death, iealousie is cruel as the graue: the coales thereof are coales of fire, which hath a most vehement flame. Heb. hard.
Many waters cannot quench loue, neither can the floods drowne it: if a man would giue all the substance of his house for loue, it would vtterly be contemned.
¶ We haue a litle sister, and shee hath no breasts: what shall we doe for our sister, in the day when she shall bee spoken for?
If she be a wall, we will build vpon her a palace of siluer: and if she bee a dore, we will inclose her with boards of Cedar.
I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found fauour. Heb. peace
Solomon had a vineyard at Baalhamon, hee let out the vineyard vnto keepers: euery one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of siluer.
My vineyard which is mine, is before me: thou (O Solomon) must haue a thousand, and those that keepe the fruit thereof, two hundred.
Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to heare it.
¶ Make haste, my beloued, and be thou like to a Roe, or to a yong Hart vpon the mountaines of spices. Heb. flee away.
